1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

2.text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

3.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

4.text: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

5.text: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

6.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

7.text: [Art] thou the first man [that] was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

8.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

9.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? [what] understandest thou, which [is] not in us?

10.text: With us [are] both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

11.text: [Are] the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

12.text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

13.text: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest [such] words go out of thy mouth?

14.text: What [is] man, that he should be clean? and [he which is] born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

15.text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

16.text: How much more abominable and filthy [is] man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

17.text: I will shew thee, hear me; and that [which] I have seen I will declare;

18.text: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid [it]:

19.text: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

20.text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all [his] days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

21.text: A dreadful sound [is] in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

22.text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

23.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, [saying], Where [is it]? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

24.text: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

25.text: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

26.text: He runneth upon him, [even] on [his] neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

27.text: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on [his] flanks.

28.text: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, [and] in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

29.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

30.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

31.text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

32.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

33.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

34.text: For the congregation of hypocrites [shall be] desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

35.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
